title: Installation issue: bzip, libtool with $padding in install tree
body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

Based off https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/16338 - OS support for $padding, I edited the file `$SPACK_ROOT/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml` and changed the install tree to have $padding. 

```
  install_tree: $padding
```
The reason was that I wanted to have a very long install path to create binary packages. My package is dependent on bzip2 and libtool, but their installation is failing.


### Steps to reproduce the issue
In config.yaml, change install tree to `install_tree: $padding`

```console
-bash-4.2$ spack install --no-cache libtool
==> Warning: gcc@4.8.5 cannot build optimized binaries for "skylake_avx512". Using best target possible: "haswell"
==> 2726: Installing libsigsegv
```
